locations.title: USAgain - Madison
locations.description:
USAgain is an environmental for-profit group that was originally founded in 1999 in Seattle, Washington. Their mission is to recycle surplus items, especially clothing, by distributing them to developing nations outside the United States.

They accept donations such as garments, footwear, accessories, children’s clothes, linens, and more. If you're not sure whether they can accept your donation, please give them a call beforehand.

locations.title: America's Thrift Stores - Adairsville
locations.description:
America’s Thrift Stores adds over 10,000 new items of donated goods to their stores – every day. All thanks to the generous donations from the thousands of Americans that give to them.

They have more than 2,500 donations bins around the country, accepting donations such as shoes, accessories, linen, appliances, electronics, toys, books, and furniture.

America’s Thrift Stores adds over 10,000 new items of donated goods to their stores – every day. All thanks to the generous donations from the thousands of Americans that give to them.

They have more than 2,500 donations bins around the country, accepting donations such as shoes, accessories, linen, appliances, electronics, toys, books, and furniture.

locations.title: Salvation Army - Atlanta
locations.description:
The Salvation Army was founded in London in 1865. Since then it has grown into a global charitable organization, currently serving in 130 countries.

Financial donations are more than welcome, but they also accept goods such as clothing, houseware, home appliances, furniture, and others. If you're not sure whether they can accept your donation, please give them a call beforehand.
locations.address: 1125 Ponce De Leon Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30306, USA

locations.title: Dress for Success - Atlanta
locations.description:
Dress for Success is a global nonprofit organization dedicated to empowering women to achieve economic independence by providing them with professional attire, support, and development tools. Donations of gently used professional clothing are collected and distributed to women seeking to enter or reenter the workforce. These donated clothes are carefully selected to help clients present themselves confidently during job interviews and in the workplace, reflecting professionalism and competence.

In addition to offering business attire, Dress for Success provides career development programs, mentoring, and networking opportunities. The organization’s goal is to address both the immediate need for proper work attire and the long-term success of women by equipping them with the skills and confidence necessary to thrive in their careers. By offering clothing donations alongside holistic career support, Dress for Success helps women gain financial independence and empowers them to break free from cycles of poverty.

locations.title: Out of the Closet - Atlanta
locations.description:
Out of the Closet is a unique chain of thrift stores operated by the AIDS Healthcare Foundation (AHF) that accepts and sells donated clothes and other items to support HIV/AIDS prevention, treatment, and advocacy efforts. Donated clothes are collected at their store locations and are either sold at affordable prices or distributed to those in need. The proceeds from sales directly fund AHF’s mission to provide cutting-edge medicine and advocacy, regardless of a person’s ability to pay.

Out of the Closet thrift stores serve multiple purposes: they offer an accessible way for people to contribute to a charitable cause, they promote sustainability by giving secondhand clothes a new life, and they provide resources for those affected by HIV/AIDS. Additionally, many store locations offer free HIV testing, making these stores a vital hub for both community engagement and public health. Out of the Closet blends charity, healthcare, and sustainability.
locations.address: 1512 Piedmont Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30324, USA
